revised_title: Feeding Habits and Hind Brain Structure in South Indian Cyprinoid Fishes
tldr: The study investigates the correlation between the feeding habits and the structure of the hind brain in South Indian cyprinoid fishes. It classifies them into two broad groups based on their feeding habits: those that feed largely by taste and those that feed mainly by sight. The research examines the structural variations in the hind brain of these fishes and their relationship to their feeding habits, providing insights into their anatomy and behavior.
